title: Gélise
text:
The Gélise () is a tributary of the river <a href="Ba%C3%AFse">Baïse</a> in <a href="Gascony">Gascony</a>, southwestern <a href="France">France</a>. It is long.
Etymology.
The name Gélise comes from the <a href="Aquitanian%20language">Aquitanian</a> <a href="hydronym">hydronym</a>ic root "Jel", meaning "watercourse."
Geography.
The Gélise originates in the <a href="Gers">Gers</a> "<a href="Departments%20of%20France">département</a>" at Cahuzères, north of <a href="Lupiac">Lupiac</a>, then it flows northwest in the direction of <a href="Eauze">Eauze</a>. It drains the land around <a href="Castelnau-d%27Auzan">Castelnau-d'Auzan</a>, then it flows northeast where it forms the natural boundary between the forest of the <a href="Landes%20of%20Gascony">Landes of Gascony</a>, the slopes of the <a href="Armagnac-T%C3%A9nar%C3%A8ze">Armagnac-Ténarèze</a>.
It unites with the Baïse just after passing the fortified mill of <a href="Lavardac">Lavardac</a> in <a href="Lot-et-Garonne">Lot-et-Garonne</a>.
The <a href="Osse%20%28river%29">Osse</a>, a right tributary, joins the Gélise near <a href="N%C3%A9rac">Nérac</a>. The <a href="Auzoue">Auzoue</a>, a right tributary, joins the Gélise at <a href="M%C3%A9zin">Mézin</a>. The <a href="Izaute">Izaute</a>, a right tributary, joins the Gélise at <a href="Saint-P%C3%A9-Saint-Simon">Saint-Pé-Saint-Simon</a>.
Départements and principal cities.
The Gélise passes through the following "départements" and cities:
